content.question: A person is in a cubical room that is <math alttext="3 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on a side. A horizontal electric field exists in the room. The person measures the potential difference between the middle of the door on one side of the room and a point at the same height on the opposite wall as <math alttext="9 volts " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, with the door at a higher potential. What are the magnitude and direction of the average electric field in the room?

choices.label: Magnitude Direction <math alttext="3 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V/m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> From the wall to the door

MagnitudeDirection<math alttext="3 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V/m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> From the door to the wall

MagnitudeDirection<math alttext="27 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V/m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> From the wall to the door

MagnitudeDirection<math alttext="27 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V/m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> From the door to the wall

content.answer: MagnitudeDirection<math alttext="3 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V/m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> From the door to the wall

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
